Build procedure

  1. Login to vSphere using fat client or web client.
  2. On the address space click and select “Hosts and Clusters”
  3. On the left hand pane, select “ITC-SAP Cluster”
  4. Right click on the “ITC-SAP Cluster” –> Click on New Virtual Machine –>
  5. Select Custom and click next –> Select “Linux Servers” and click Next –>
  6. Select one of the datastores that has space click next –> Select Virtual Machine Version 11 –>
  7. Choose “Linux” and “Redhat Enterprise Linux 7 (64 bit) click next –> Select the number of cores/sockets –>
  8. Select correct amount of memory –> Select the correct VLAN –> Select VMWARE Paravirtual SCSI controller –>
  9. Create a New disk –> Enter 70G size select Thin provision. –> Click next on the next screen –>
  10. Check edit settings and click Continue –> At the edit screen Add an additional hard disks for data and paging
  11. Create a virtual disk for datavg size 40G for ERP systems.For HANA or any special app servers, please use the appropriate size as per the request.
  12. Create a second virtual disk for paging space. ( Use the table below to pick the right size ) –> Please follow the order in which disks are created because the snippets will create datavg on sdb ( second disk ) and paging vg on sdc ( 3rd disk ).
  13. On the Options window, enable “Memory/CPU Hotplug” –>
  14. Change the Boot options to “10000” –> Click Finish
